comments.body: Wouldn't your pickaxe like melt
BothCarnival432 the counter argument would be wouldn't the sword, but the counter to that would be the handle. I agree with you Both.
it should mine slower though.
Undervoted. Needs way more attention.
Good way to balance it would be to make it not compatible with Silk Touch or Fortune, and make it so you lose an additional amount of durability every time you mine an ore
Soul Flame makes no sense. How would a player, made of carbon presumably, would burn blue.
Same thing for Fire Aspect as well (Soul Fire Aspect/Fire Aspect III).
maybe you could make it work for fire immune mobs but do less damage than regular fire would because they are immune to fire
I just had this same idea, hope it's not too late to sugest... it fits too well
If purple fire is added (look it up) there could be enchantment books for that as well, although I am not sure where you would get them
Make it very rare,as rare as netherite hoe was, because once it gets, it will be used for longer time on bow, and it will have much value as well.
Soul Flame Or Hellflame Will make blue flames?? COOl
having it deal more armor damage, more damage to mobs (not players), and slight damage to fire imune mobs would both change pvp and add a reason to look for it
is it on bedrock edition or java edition
maybe it could be in 1.20 or next 1.19 update like 1.19.20
it is a cool idea and i want it!
This would be a great advancement for Minecraft Bedrock users, it would be an incredible tool to better decorate and detail new areas.
yes
I love that idea!
Disagree with last part. It should give you the head of player skin that just blew up.
Yes. I need heads everywhere.
Ultra Gamer64 I agree. The explosion shouldn't drop heads of other mobs besides players, zombies, creepers, skeletons, and wither skeletons, but the head of the player will match their skin.
Oh! More food items would be great and this is a wonderful use for honey. Would love to see this.
Anything that makes honey stuff more useful is great with me ^^
Call it Glazed Ham
It's very neat looking, and would be a massive help for building. Maybe the type of bookcases you use around an enchantment table influences the type on enchantments you should get?
I dont think it should replace the bookshelf but it would be a cool addition.
It would be a nice little reference to Terraria's cursed flame torches too.
Yes, yes please. And if it isn't already a thing, soul fire lanterns should get a waterlogged variant.

Torches for underwater exploration would be really nice - especially considering the upcoming aquifers. The blue color of soul fire would also greatly complement underwater builds made of prismarine or warped fungus.
That's what I was thinking!
Maybe balance this out with needing more then one regular arrow for one lingering arrow.

I actually like that cauldrons can be used to make tipped arrows with splash potions, it gives more use to the cauldron and makes sense. But, I think this is a Bedrock only feature, for whatever reason.
I'm surprised that this isn't its use already. But I kinda want to see what Mojang would do with it.

Funnily enough, I had this same idea before I saw this post, although I imagined the potion slot being located above the arrow slot. Here's a mock-up gui that I designed for the fletching table.

Also, I think that it would be best to let the player put in up to 8 arrows, just like in the crafting grid, where more would cause the arrow to have an x over it, similar to an anvil or villager.

I was gonna come up with the same idea. Use the table to make tipped arrows. I love it it makes sense but we would need 3 slots for the arrow, potion and maybe dragons breath. Or just 2 slots for the lingering potion and arrow.

I had a similar idea, however, on bedrock 64 tipped arrows can already be made in a cauldron with only 3 regular potions. Lingering potions are hard to get for many players especially early or mid game which would make this unusable for most players. I think that regular potions should be used in the table. I would say approximately 32 arrows to a potion to make this more useful than cauldrons on bedrock. The idea of having 1 arrow produce multiple arrows makes sense as well, however I would only do one or the other. Finally, I would also consider having the ability to add multiple potions to the arrow at the table. I would say up to 4 potions should be allowed. Obviously, effects such as healing and harming could not be applied together (or maybe they could and would just cancel out, I'm not sure). Either way, I think this would be the best idea for the fletching table because it is fairly useful and goes along with the theme of the table.

Yes, but calibrate so that all the already existing features are not removed but balanced. For example:

On the crafting table: 8 arrows + lingering potion = 8 tipped arrows (all level 1 and minimum duration even with longer/level 2 potions).

In a cauldron: 16 arrows + cauldron filled with a potion = 16 tipped arrows (all level 1 and minimum duration even with longer/level 2 potions).

On a fletching table: 16/32/64 arrows + normal/splash/lingering potion = 16/32/64 tipped arrows (respectively and all with the potion's level or duration).

Additionally, adding a way to make normal arrows on the fletching table twice as profitable.

Would love to see this but instead of removing the crafting table recipe why not allow for a easier way to create tipped arrows by just allowing a splash/regular potion as others have said(downside being like reduced how many arrows you get or increasing how many from lingering etc). 

Would allow players post nether to get more out of the nether but not OP for early game players / Not useless Post enderdragon

Now this is a cool idea. It gives golden tools a unique use while also not making them directly stronger than any of the other tools. The quality of life change to thw pickaxe mining level is really nice too.

I actually had this same idea a couple of days ago with extra enchantment levels, but I think it'd be better if the existing enchantments just affected gold more. For example, Sharpness V gives a sword 3 more attack damage, but on a Gold Sword, you could make it so it increases the damage by 4 or 5. Still a good idea and I  hope it gets added to the game!

Perhaps gold tools could have exclusive enchantments. For instance, a golden pickaxe could convert iron/gold ore into several items of dust, which could be smelted into ingots. You would receive around 2-4 dust per 1 iron/gold ore.

I would also like the gold tools to have more durability than stone, but less than iron of course. It just doesn't make any sense that they're worse than wood tools now.

Exclusive enchanting for gold also seems cool. If gold had some crazy enchants that would explain the durability level, then and only then I would be satisfied with current durability.
I agree with increasing the mining level of gold tools. Gold tools can't even mine gold ore! Fortune IV would also be useless if you could only use it on coal.

Gold tools get better enchantments, so I had the idea to make that actually useful.

Make it so gold tools can't be forged with enchanted books anymore, instead make it so the book can be forged with the gold tool. That would make it possible to enchant a golden tool, see if the enchantments are good and if so forge it on a book to be used on a diamond/netherite tool.

Legend of Zelda? BRUUUUH THAT'S ALL I NEEDED TO HEAR!  XD

Seriously I think this would be cool!
I had a similar idea except it would be Ice 7

I too would like to see the Red Ice from Zelda translate over to Minecraft. 
It should generate in the Crimson Forest biome and only melt when exposed to Soul Fire.
Great idea, but maybe after eating five different foods then you wouldn't dislike the first one anymore. Also maybe you would have to eat multiple of one food to dislike it.
There is a mod like this except its the other way around: a certain type of food becomes usless if eaten too much. Its really annoying.
個人認為在不同的遊戲難度級別中可以有不同的“食物獎勵”
How about soul salmon?
You should be able to cook the fish to get they’re ore type.
Use it to catch a lava fish. When you eat a lava fish it gives you fire resistance and the ability to swim in lava.
If not a source of ores, then maybe a source of food. Maybe you'd need a Netherite Rod to fish in lava.
i would love to fish in the nether! a way to make it more dangerous is have a chance to fish up a ghast or blaze thats "hiding under the lava"
How do you catch them, maybe a new fishing rod crafted with 3 sticks, 1 string and a netherite scrap?

Or just let us fish in lava anywhere, but instead of fish, we get unique items. Maybe make it so we can only fish in lava with an enchanted pole? As the OP says, it doesn't break the game because it's quite dangerous to fish in lava. Stand too close, or accidentally break a block with your pole, and whoosh!
Awesome!
This is also an issue for explosions which makes no since Ancient Debris and Netherite Blocks are blast resistant. The Nether Star item is already like this.
That could be a way to inspire creativity in the game. I like it as a fun little block!
As creative as this sounds, there really isnt a way to add that in. That would be a sight to behold though not gonna lie about that.
not shut this idea down, but why? And how would this block be useful?  Or even the crafting recipe
No

This doesn't seem doable...

It also feels too mod-y of an idea.
lpl
There is a mod. It is called the More TNT mod.

Jak to miecz
?
Omg reindoł tnt
Rainbow TNT
Make a rainbow TNT
Rainbow tnt
Maybe you could shear a llama to get llama wool to make these boots? Would make llamas a little more useful.

Maybe a whole mountain armor, crafted by adding 1 ou several goat's wool to leather armor. It doesn't give you extra armor, but give a bonus capacity for each pieces: not sinking in snowier snow for boots, not taking damage from cold in extreme high or snow storm from chest, etc. It can have disavantage to like being slowier or taking damage from overheat in hot biomes or under a certain high.
I like the idea of a new use for llamas! Depending on the llama's color, you could get different variants as well

Here is my vision of the crafting recipe:

|                                                  |     Leather boots     |                                                  |

|      Sticks/crushdBmboo    |     Sticks/crushdBmboo     |     Sticks/crushdBmboo   |

|                                             |                                             |                                         |

Using crushed bamboo will be the best. If you use sticks you will sink at 0.125 blocks per second, however it will refresh each step you take, which means you cannot spend to much time in one spot, but will for the most part avoid other dangers of walking in powder snow as I suggested in this comment in powder snow feedback. I will explain what crushed bamboo in the comments of this post.
The snow shoes could possibly made with leather and sticks. The idea of skis and sleds would also be amazing.
Mundane in Minecraft is like a gone wrong potion and I would like to see something maybe like a way to fix the potion .
I was thinking mundane potions could make weaker versions of existing potions but last much longer

I think this is a really good idea, i was just brewing and forgot to put in nether warts first and wasted so much blaze powder. I made over 30 mundane potion and my nearest nether fortress is over 2000 blocks away. Something like this would be really useful and is a really good idea.
I think it's a great idea because there is ores in the under world and over world. What do you guys think?!
It would be cool to have your friends listening to your music. Also, it could also be a backpack feature instead.
We definitively need this as a feature, since PIGSTEP is now a thing.
I was thinking of putting it anywhere in your hotbar, since you might want a shield or something in your offhand.
this seems like a very great idea
YES!! What I've been looking for ever since Pigstep music disk cam out

It can be a feature included with the Deep Dark. Surround a jukebox with one of the skulk items in a crafting table to make it portable. But mobs can hear it too, so you have to be careful when you listen.

The pig has felt a little less useful sense the horse was added...

This idea is great!
I agree. Or maybe allow them in the creation of suspicious stew instead of a flower to get the luck effect, since they're kinda rare-ish?

A year ago after playing Stardew Valley I thought of this, glad I'm not the only one to think of this to a solution to the pigs uselessness.

Although maybe there are better things that truffles could be used for, there already is plenty of ways to make a good amount of emeralds.
That Is EXACTLY What I Thought!

100% support! Cows give meat, milk, and leather, chickens give meat, feathers, and eggs, and sheep give meat and wool. But what do pigs give right now? Meat, and only meat. This would make them way more useful! However, having it only work in Dark Forests seems a bit too rare, so I propose that it also work in Swamps.
I think there should be diffrent "tiers" of truffles, that are worth more or less, depending on villager so it cant be abused to get alot of emeralds

Still pretty useless. Plus have you tried eating a truffle? They are used to give some flavour to main dishes, not as main dish themselves: by themselves they're awful. Truffles should be usable as ingredient or idk, not as food source, what the heck.

That said, with all the various ways to make emeralds with villagers, this would just be a useless trade that noone would use.
This is a pretty cool idea!!  Let's do this!
I agree it could also be so u need the saddle and carrot on a stick so that feature is also not as  useless because its way faster to just ride on a horse.
I like this idea, However, say I HATE orange and I love Fire Aspect and Fire Aspect is orange. So considering everything this update brings, I am not a fan.

Why don't you do this, for example: I have an iron sword with very good enchantments, but I want to take this enchantments from the iron one and put in my diamond one. Please, it would be great if you do that, and if it happens, please, put it also in the Bedrock Edition.
Maybe add redstone and emerald as an option for enchanting. Lapis lazuli isn't that special in my opinion.
This would be great as an indicator for when an armor has thorns or blast resistance.
This is an awsome idea!

This would be super useful to have patterns on shulker boxes, could use the same patterns as the ones banners use. We need a better way of sorting boxes, and a nice addition would be if they also had the name above them as if name-tagged. Please Mojang!
With some banner customisation I could make a Companion Cube shulker box!

I think we at least need some more colors and options. There are 27 spaces in an echest and filling each with a shulker will mean multiples of each color. I can imagine people finding cool uses for patterns on shulkers.

Another option would be to implement a carpet/pattern similar to llamas. Each shulker gets a carpet slot, and each carpet colour has it's own texture which is overlayed on top of the shulker's colour.
Could also allow the smithing templates to work on shulkers
Amazing idea!

This: gets added
You: get a cape of people getting capes
a cape cape

I also had this idea, but I would suggest an improvement to it. If you think of an idea for feedback, but someone has already made a suggestion for something quite similar, but your idea is a bit different, you could comment your suggested change to the idea, and if Mojang decides that they will add in the suggestion with your suggested change included, you get a cape, maybe with an arrow or something else superimposed over the original cape for the suggestion to show that you improved it, maybe also have an image on part of the cape (or the inside face) that shows the suggestion you added to the feedback idea. 

I overall white like the suggestion because it gives a way for people who don't particularly like visiting events or doing minigames/pvp some way of showing their passion in Minecraft (Like me, I'm a Bedrock redstoner who has submitted some other feedback suggestions to improve Bedrock redstone) that actually confers status, as any specific cape would only go to one person, the person who made the suggestion, and more liked feedback ideas would in practice have higher status.
EGYPT

New mud block made from dirt being next to water. Also, it dries up if not next to water during the day, and becomes dried mud. If you want to make mud bricks you must use a furnace or blast furnace. Dried mud will turn into dirt if next to water for long enough.
The mud before dried into bricks could be useful for a pig pen or where you keep your pigs for breeding.

This seems like a good idea, as many ancient civilizations made use of mud bricks, and adding them to the game could add a good early-game building material. I think that they should be made by putting 4 dirt blocks into the crafting table in a square, similar to how normal bricks are made.
Just yes man.
That's amazing dude
No, it should just shoot the pufferfish :)
